text: Women's Rights National Historical Park (est.1980) consists of four historical properties in Seneca Falls and Waterloo, New York. These properties are important to women's rights. They are the Wesleyan Chapel (the site of the first Women's Rights Convention); the Elizabeth Cady Stanton House; the M'Clintock House; and the Richard Hunt House. The park consists of 6.83 acres (27,600 mÂ²). It includes a visitor center and an education and cultural center. The Votes For Women History Trail (est. 2009) is administered through the Park. It is a motor vehicle route of sites in upstate New York important to women's rights. Sites include the Susan B. Anthony House; the Mount Hope Cemetery; Antoinette Louisa Brown Blackwell Childhood Home; the M'Clintock House; and The Women's Rights National Historic Park itself. ==Gallery== File:WesleyanChapel.JPG|Remains of the Wesleyan Chapel File:ECStanton house2.jpg|Elizabeth Cady Stanton House File:HUNT HOUSE.jpg|M'Clintock House File:JANE HUNT HOUSE.jpg|Hunt House ==Other websites== * Women's Rights National Historic Park Category:National Historical Parks of the United States
title: Women's Rights National Historical Park
